alert.note: Alert for Athens; Meigs; Vinton; Washington (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 17 at 11:32PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Meigs, southwestern Washington, southeastern Vinton and southern Athens Counties through MIDNIGHT EDT... At 1132 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Albany, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Athens, Pomeroy, Albany, Coolville, Rutland, Tuppers Plains, Chester, Amesville, Stroud Run State Park, Dyesville, Darwin, Harrisonville, Dexter and Carpenter. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM EDT for western West Virginia.
